original_solution_mapping.L1: 2/3 of the birds are chickens because 1 -(1/3)=2/3
original_solution_mapping.L3: It will cost $20 to feed them because 10 x 2=<<10*2=20>>20

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4889.
    Returns: the total cost to feed the chickens.
    """
    # L1
    total_fraction = 1 # WK
    duck_fraction = Fraction(1, 3) # 1/3 are ducks
    chicken_fraction = total_fraction - duck_fraction

    # L2
    total_birds = 15 # Peter has 15 birds
    num_chickens = total_birds * chicken_fraction

    # L3
    cost_per_chicken = 2 # costs $2 per bird
    total_cost = num_chickens * cost_per_chicken

    # FA
    answer = total_cost
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: {chicken_fraction} of the birds are chickens because {total_fraction} -({duck_fraction})={chicken_fraction}
It will cost ${total_cost} to feed them because {num_chickens} x {cost_per_chicken}=<<{num_chickens}*{cost_per_chicken}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: 2/3 of the birds are chickens because 1 -(1/3)=2/3
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: It will cost $30 to feed them because 15 x 2=<<15*2=30>>30

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'total_fraction' (value: 1) was used instead of 'chicken_fraction' (value: 2/3).
